component.name: Alert
component.description: Display a prominent inline message for contextual feedback or important notices.

useCases: Success or error feedback after an action
Warning notices about destructive or irreversible operations

commonPatterns.name: info-alert
commonPatterns.description: Informational notice with icon, title, and description
commonPatterns.composition:
<Alert variant="info">
  <InfoIcon />
  <AlertTitle>New update available</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>Version 2.0 includes performance improvements.</AlertDescription>
</Alert>

commonPatterns.name: destructive-alert
commonPatterns.composition:
<Alert variant="destructive">
  <AlertCircle />
  <AlertTitle>Something went wrong</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>Please try again or contact support.</AlertDescription>
  <AlertAction><Button variant="outline" size="xs">Retry</Button></AlertAction>
</Alert>

commonPatterns.name: success-alert
commonPatterns.composition:
<Alert variant="success">
  <CheckCircle />
  <AlertTitle>Changes saved</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>Your preferences have been updated.</AlertDescription>
</Alert>

commonPatterns.name: warning-alert
commonPatterns.description: Cautionary notice before a potentially destructive action

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Alert for toast-style ephemeral notifications
antiPatterns.reason: Alerts are static inline elements; ephemeral feedback should use a toast system
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a Toast or Sonner component for transient messages

antiPatterns.reason: Alerts are non-blocking; confirmations require user acknowledgment

antiPatterns.scenario: Stacking multiple alerts of the same type
antiPatterns.reason: Creates visual noise and reduces the impact of each message
antiPatterns.alternative: Consolidate messages into a single alert or use a list inside AlertDescription

semanticMeaning.default: Neutral informational message on standard background
semanticMeaning.destructive: Error or failure state requiring attention
semanticMeaning.success: Confirmation that an action completed successfully

slots.icon: SVG icon rendered in the first grid column (optional; triggers two-column layout)
slots.title: AlertTitle for the heading text
slots.action: AlertAction for an absolutely positioned action element (e.g., close button)

interactions.static: Alert is a non-interactive display element by default
interactions.action: Optional AlertAction slot supports interactive dismiss or retry buttons

responsive.mobile: Full-width block display with text wrapping

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Not directly keyboard-interactive; action buttons within are tabbable
accessibility.screenReader: Announced as an alert region; title and description are read sequentially
accessibility.focusManagement: No focus trapping; action buttons follow standard tab order

rules: Always include an AlertTitle for screen reader clarity
Match variant to semantic meaning: destructive for errors, success for confirmations, warning for cautions
Include an icon as the first child to activate the two-column grid layout
AlertAction is absolutely positioned in the top-right corner; suitable for small action buttons or close icons

aiHints.context: Use for static inline feedback messages that persist on the page. Choose variant based on semantic meaning. For blocking confirmations, use AlertDialog instead. For ephemeral notifications, use a toast system.
